cluster_relations.rel_desc: The young couple hears the news report as part of the narrative.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: when parked in a secluded area

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Communities share stories among their members.
Stories are disseminated via the internet, enabling rapid sharing.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: In the age of the internet and social media
qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: at lightning speed, in a matter of seconds

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Stories are disseminated via social media platforms.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: In the age of the internet and social media
qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: at lightning speed, in a matter of seconds

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Urban legends are disseminated by being shared and reshared across multiple platforms and mediums.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject receives or obtains information or a message from the object.
args.justification: This relation instance describes a young couple hearing a news report; semantically it is an information reception event where the subject receives information from the object.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject shares, tells, or circulates a story or narrative represented by the object.
args.justification: This instance describes communities sharing stories among members; the core predicate is the act of sharing a story from a group to its members, so a specific story-sharing predicate is appropriate.
args.remark: If future data shows widespread use for sharing other content types, this could later be generalized to a broader 'shares_content' predicate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (e.g., a story or legend) is disseminated or transmitted through the medium, platform, or channel represented by the object.
args.justification: All three instances describe narratives (stories, urban legends) being disseminated via specific media or channels (internet, social media, platforms and mediums). They share the same direction and semantics of dissemination via a medium, so a single normalized predicate is appropriate.

All these relations are about communication processes: receiving information from a news report, communities sharing stories, and stories/urban legends being disseminated via media channels. They naturally belong to a common class capturing transmission of information and narratives between agents and through media.

Each relation involves the flow or exchange of information: communication reception, sharing, or dissemination through channels. This fits the broad semantic dimension of communication rather than composition, causality, or other groups.
